festival.introText:
Love Saves The Day is different to any other festival. It is an accumulation of years and years spent in clubs, in fields, at festivals, on dancefloors, and in front of stages across the United Kingdom and beyond.

Essentially, the team behind Love Saves the Day 2023 know exactly what it takes to make an event a success. As regular festival goers they have learnt through the years what works, what doesn't, what festival attendees want, and what they don’t. It's this understanding and knowledge that has paid dividends in organizing a fantastic and memorable festival experience.

Collectively, their history of events includes Secret Garden Party, In:Motion Series, See No Evil and Global Gathering amongst a string of others. Love Saves The Day sees Bristol-based innovators, Team Love; curators behind Glastonbury’s Wow stage collaborate with pioneering party starters, Just Jack, and the impeccable Futureboogie to bring back the magic to the heart of Bristol.

reviews.title: Review of Love Saves The Day
Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
reviews.body: New venue for lstd was brilliant and all the stuff they have to offer away from the music was well rounded. I went on the roller disco and didn't last long but think I had to much to drink 😄. The only gripe I have is they ran out of drink to fast at a few bars and prices were a bit ott. 15 for a basic wine is to much and 4.50 for a can of Morgans and coke when it's 1.99 anywhere is slightly taking the mick. But I would go again and recommend but probably drink before I went and hold off buying loads of drinks.

reviews.title: Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
reviews.body: First year at love saves the day and il DEFO go again nxt year.. Hopefully both days! Had the best day!

reviews.title: Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
reviews.body: This was the most unimaginative appalling excuse for a festival and a devastating blow for what is normally a thoroughly creative city. Day light robbery. 50 to queue on the most incredibly large line, then upon arriving inside the 'organisers' had not even done the maths and every bar had a 100m long queue. What an embarrassing mess. Go and research how to organise something properly before charging ridiculously high amounts.

reviews.title: Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
reviews.body: I thought this event was overcrowded. Ticket allocation was far to high. The music was awesome but less people would have meant more fun.

reviews.title: Review of Love Saves The Day 2015
reviews.body: Better in eastville park. Sound was a bit poor in some tents.. Definately more for the kiddies

faqs.question: When is Love Saves The Day 2023?
faqs.answer: Love Saves The Day takes place on Saturday 27th & Sunday 28th May 2023.

faqs.question: What happens if I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent. Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where is Love Saves The Day?
faqs.answer: Love Saves The Day is located at Ashton Court, Bristol.
